C_liora.name: Liora Virelia
C_liora.role: Systems engineer; harmonic theorist; cultural liaison.
C_liora.notes: Primary POV of the High Era collapse; author of the treatise that seeds Resolve doctrine.

C_damiar.name: Damiar Colven
C_damiar.notes: Warm, conflict-averse, institutional loyalist who later regrets delaying warnings.

C_heska.name: Heska Astrin
C_heska.notes: Records the last days of unity; preserves Liora’s fragments for future archives.

C_nereth.name: Nereth Kestrel
C_nereth.notes: First to observe echo-lag and corridor flex; becomes technical folk-hero among Shard engineers.

C_lochran.name: Lochran Davieth
C_lochran.role: Chair of the Beacon Harmonization Authority.
C_lochran.notes: Leads cooperative safety; his certification sigils become the earliest Many Crowns symbols.

C_iskari.name: Iskari Telvek
C_iskari.role: Head of safety compliance; proto-Fleet ethics architect.
C_iskari.notes: Her safety codes evolve into Resolve and early Fleet corridor doctrine.

C_ruvian.name: Ruvian Marrek
C_ruvian.notes: Voice for neglected worlds; progenitor of Shard practical survival ethos.

C_aveth.name: Aveth Saelith
C_aveth.notes: Keeps trade and medical convoys alive; delivers Liora’s treatise across broken lanes.

C_orneth.name: Orneth Hailen
C_orneth.role: BHA field enforcer; early Crown model.
C_orneth.notes: Represents strict order; his enforcement posture becomes a core Many Crowns archetype.

C_coalitionTech.name: Coalition Technician
C_coalitionTech.notes: Caught between ethics and hierarchy during the override incident.

C_trafficCtrl.name: Transit Controller
C_trafficCtrl.notes: Manages civilian panic as timestamps and lanes destabilize.

C_traveler.name: Concerned Traveler
C_traveler.notes: Human-scale reflection of corridor collapse anxieties.

C_localLeader.name: Local Leader
C_localLeader.notes: Represents immediate survival governance in Post-Break transition zones.

C_fieldOfficer.name: Field Officer
C_fieldOfficer.notes: Implements first proto-crown safety marks during the breakdown.

C_shipCaptain.name: Ship Captain
C_shipCaptain.notes: Provides external POV on stress-field distortions.

C_courier.name: Courier
C_courier.notes: Transports Liora’s treatise physically across broken corridor space.

C_coreAdvocate.name: Core Advocate
C_coreAdvocate.notes: Pushes for strict protocol reinstatement in refugee zones.

C_vergeVoice.name: Verge Voice
C_vergeVoice.notes: Asserts adaptive logistics and decentralized decision-making.

C_outerTech.name: Outer Technician
C_outerTech.notes: Represents early Shard improvisational engineering practices.

C_engineer.name: Resolve Engineer
C_engineer.notes: Helps unify Iskari’s codes with fragments of Liora’s treatise.

C_reader.name: Treatise Reader
C_reader.notes: Reads doctrine excerpts inside the early Resolve circle.

C_archivist.name: Archive Curator
C_archivist.notes: Prepares early Archive holdings that will later inform Stormwell Codex.

C_announcer.name: Festival Announcer
C_announcer.role: Public speaker during High Era festivals.
C_announcer.notes: Adds tonal contrast before the collapse begins.

C_staff.name: Port Staffer
C_staff.notes: Delivers human-scale reactions to systemic breakdown.
